sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Bottle Filling Machine for accurate and automated filling of liquid pharmaceutical products into bottles.
sections.scope: Applicable to liquid filling activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the machine is installed in a clean area meeting GMP requirements.
Verify that all utilities including electricity, compressed air, and water are connected.
Check that the product to be filled is prepared, filtered, and at proper temperature.
Power ON the bottle filling machine and initialize the control system.
Select the appropriate filling nozzles based on bottle neck size and fill volume.
Set the fill volume and adjust the volumetric or gravimetric controls accordingly.
Install the correct bottle size parts including guides, stars, and grippers.
Adjust the bottle conveyor height and speed settings.
Fill the product tank or reservoir with the prepared liquid formulation.
Prime the filling lines by running product through nozzles to remove air.
Place empty bottles on the infeed conveyor and start the machine at low speed.
Verify that bottles are properly positioned under filling nozzles.
Check the fill volume of initial bottles using graduated cylinder or balance.
Adjust fill time or volume settings if deviation from target volume is observed.
Once accuracy is confirmed, increase machine speed to production rate.
Monitor the filling operation continuously for consistent volume and no spillage.
Check that no-bottle-no-fill sensor is functioning to prevent product wastage.
Periodically verify fill volume during production run.
After completion, drain remaining product from tank and lines.
Perform cleaning-in-place (CIP) or manual cleaning as per SOPs.
Sanitize all product contact surfaces before the next production run.
Document fill volumes, machine settings, and deviations in the batch record.
precautions: Ensure bottles are clean and free from particulate matter before filling.
Maintain aseptic conditions if filling sterile or preservative-free products.
Prevent cross-contamination by thorough cleaning between different products.
Check for leaks in filling lines and nozzles before starting.
Ensure proper bottle placement to avoid spills and wastage.
Monitor fill accuracy regularly to ensure dose uniformity.
Use appropriate product-contact materials compatible with the formulation.
Wear appropriate PPE including gloves, gown, and hair cover.
Follow cleaning validation protocols for product changeover.
Ensure proper disposal of spillage and rejected bottles.
